intro: Guaiacum parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved guaiac木, is a species of flowering plant in the family Zingiberaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in spikes, and it produces dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Guaiacum parvifolium is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
